operations.summary: Get a list of snapshots in a cluster.
operations.notes: Get a list of snapshots in a cluster.

Create Virtual Machine snapshots.

If a UUID is specified for the snapshot, this operation will be idempotent.

If multiple VMs are specified, all of their configurations and disks will fall into the same consistency group. Since this operation requires the coordination of multiple resources, it should not be abused by specifying more than several VMs at a time.

Snapshots are crash-consistent. They do not include the VM's current memory image, only the VM configuration and its disk contents. The snapshot is taken atomically across all of a VM's configuration and disks to ensure consistency.

This is also an asynchronous operation that results in the creation of a task object. The UUID of this task object is returned as the response of this operation. This task can be monitored by using the /tasks/poll API.

Delete a snapshot.

This operation is idempotent. The logical timestamp can optionally be provided for consistency. If a logical timestamp is specified, then this operation will be rejected if the logical timestamp specified is not the value of the snapshot logical timestamp.

This is also an asynchronous operation that results in the creation of a task object. The UUID of this task object is returned as the response of this operation. This task can be monitored by using the /tasks/poll API.

operations.summary: Get details of a specified snapshot.
operations.notes: Get details of a specified snapshot.

Clone a Snapshot.

If a UUID is specified for the cloned snapshot, then the operation will be idempotent.

If overrideNetworkConfig is set to true in the clone spec, then the source snapshot's network configuration is overridden by one specified in the nic list. If false, the clone will inherit its basic network configuration from the source, minus MAC and IP address.

This is also an asynchronous operation that results in the creation of a task object.This is also an asynchronous operation that results in the creation of a task object. The UUID of this task object is returned as the response of this operation. This task can be monitored by using the /tasks/poll API.

boot_device_order.description: The boot device order. In case boot device is not specified or the specified boot device fails, VM will attempt to boot from connected devices in this device type order.

boot_device_type.description: The device from which to boot. This must refer to a valid device configured on the VM. When a boot device is removed from the VM, this field is cleared as a side effect. If no boot device is configured, the VM will have the following boot preference: hard disk, CD-ROM, NIC.

disk_address.description: Disk address selected as boot device. At most one of this or macAddr field should be set.
disk_address.notes: Disk address selected as boot device

mac_addr.description: Mac address of the NIC selected as boot device. At most one of this or diskAddress field should be set.
mac_addr.notes: Mac address of the NIC selected as boot device

snapshot_specs.description: List of snapshot specifications. All disks for all Virtual Machines are treated as a single consistency group for the vdisk snapshot

uuid.description: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence.
uuid.notes: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence.

boot_config.description: Override the existing boot configuration for the Virtual Machine. Any updates to the boot configuration will be applied during the next Virtual Machine power cycle but not reset.
boot_config.notes: Override the existing boot configuration for the Virtual Machine.

memory_mb.description: Override the amount of RAM assigned to the clone.
memory_mb.notes: Override the amount of RAM assigned to the clone.

name.description: Named for the cloned Virtual Machine.
name.notes: Name for the cloned Virtual Machine.

num_cores_per_vcpu.description: Override the number of cores assigned to each VCPUs.
num_cores_per_vcpu.notes: Override the number of cores assigned to each VCPUs.

num_vcpus.description: Override the number of vCPUs assigned to the clone.
num_vcpus.notes: Override the number of vCPUs assigned to the clone.

override_network_config.description: Indicate whether the source Virtual Machine's/snapshot's network configuration with the one specified in the vmNics field. If false, the clone will inherit its basic network configuration from the source, minus MAC and IP address assignments.
override_network_config.notes: Whether to override the source Virtual Machine's/snapshot's network configuration.

uuid.description: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence. This UUID will be used as the vm ID of the target vm.
uuid.notes: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence

vm_nics.description: Network configuration. Required when overrideNetworkConfig set to true.
vm_nics.notes: Network configuration. Required when overrideNetworkConfig set to true.

device_bus.description: The device bus for the virtual disk device.Possible values are SCSI, IDE and PCI. Along with this the deviceIndex is used to specify a vdisk address. When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.
device_bus.notes: The device bus for the virtual disk device.

device_index.description: Index of the device on the adapter type. If left unspecified, the system will allocate the next available slot on the default bus.
device_index.notes: Index of the device on the adapter type.

ndfs_filepath.description: NDFS path to existing virtual disk. This field will not be set when this message is used in a create mode.When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.
ndfs_filepath.notes: NDFS path to existing virtual disk.

vmdisk_uuid.description: Virtual disk identifier. This field will not be set when this message is used in a create mode. When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.

adapter_type.description: Type of the network adapter for ESX networks.

mac_address.description: The MAC address of the NIC
mac_address.notes: The MAC address of the NIC

network_uuid.description: The network to which the NIC is attached
network_uuid.notes: The network to which the NIC is attached

request_ip.description:
If request_ip is true
If 'requestedIpAddress' is set then request that IP from the network. If it's a managed network then request a dynamic IP from the network. Otherwise don't request an IP. If requestIp is false, then don't request an IP at all, regardless of whether or not the 'requestedIpAddress' is set and whether or the network is managed or not.

boot_device_order.description: The boot device order. In case boot device is not specified or the specified boot device fails, VM will attempt to boot from connected devices in this device type order.

boot_device_type.description: The device from which to boot. This must refer to a valid device configured on the VM. When a boot device is removed from the VM, this field is cleared as a side effect. If no boot device is configured, the VM will have the following boot preference: hard disk, CD-ROM, NIC.

disk_address.description: Disk address selected as boot device. At most one of this or macAddr field should be set.
disk_address.notes: Disk address selected as boot device

mac_addr.description: Mac address of the NIC selected as boot device. At most one of this or diskAddress field should be set.
mac_addr.notes: Mac address of the NIC selected as boot device

destination_path.description: Destination path in the VM at which the file specified by source_path should be copied to.
destination_path.notes: Destination path in the VM at which the file specified by sourcePath should be copied to.

source_path.description: ADSF path of the source file to inject in the VM. Must be of form: adsf:///<ctr>/...
source_path.notes: ADSF path of the source file to inject in the VM.

created_time.description: The epoch time in microseconds when this snapshot was created.
created_time.notes: The epoch time in microseconds when this snapshot was created.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the snapshot has been deleted and waiting to be garbage collected. If this is marked as true, no operations can be performed on this snapshot.
deleted.notes: Indicates if the snapshot has been deleted.

group_uuid.description: UUID of the consistency group for this snapshot
group_uuid.notes: UUID of the consistency group for this snapshot

logical_timestamp.description: Logical timestamp specified for consistency. This can be obtained from the snapshot object

uuid.description: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence.
uuid.notes: A version 4 UUID that the client may specify for idempotence.

vm_create_spec.description: A specification for creating VMs from this snapshot.
vm_create_spec.notes: A specification for creating VMs from this snapshot.

datasource_type.description: The type of datasource for configuring the Linux Virtual Machine in case cloudinit config is provided. ISO based datasource supported by Uhura is ConfigDriveV2.
datasource_type.notes: The type of datasource for configuring the Linux Virtual Machine in case cloudinit config is provided.

files_to_inject_list.description: List of details about files to inject in the VM.
files_to_inject_list.notes: List of details about files to inject in the VM.

fresh_install.description: Indicates whether the VM to be customized is meant to be freshly installed via Windows Setup from a Windows OS DVD or whether the VM will be configured from a 'Sysprepped' image in which case the setup was already complete.
fresh_install.notes: Indicates whether the VM to be customized is meant to be freshly installed or not.

userdata.description: Userdata in string format. Either Cloudinit format for customizing Linux VM or Sysprep format for customizing Windows VM. For cloudinit the userdata is usually a yaml file or shell script. For sysprep the userdata is usually a Xml representation of an unattend file in string format.Either this or userdataPath must be provided

userdata_path.description: Userdata source path. Must begin with adsf:///<ctr>.For cloudinit usually a yaml file or shell script is provided. For sysprep usually an unattend file or answer file is provided. Either this or userdata must be provided

device_bus.description: The device bus for the virtual disk device.Possible values are SCSI, IDE and PCI. Along with this the deviceIndex is used to specify a vdisk address. When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.
device_bus.notes: The device bus for the virtual disk device.

device_index.description: Index of the device on the adapter type. If left unspecified, the system will allocate the next available slot on the default bus.
device_index.notes: Index of the device on the adapter type.

disk_label.description: Information about attached disk. Disk label (for example, scsi0:0) where the virtual disk was attached. This indicates the location of the virtual disk within the VM.

is_cdrom.description: Whether this is a CD-ROM drive.
is_cdrom.notes: Whether this is a CD-ROM drive.

ndfs_filepath.description: NDFS path to existing virtual disk. This field will not be set when this message is used in a create mode.When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.
ndfs_filepath.notes: NDFS path to existing virtual disk.

vmdisk_uuid.description: Virtual disk identifier. This field will not be set when this message is used in a create mode. When specifying a vmdisk address, then only one of the following combinations of fields must be set - (device_bus, device_index) or vmdisk_uuid or ndfs_filepath.

adapter_type.description: Type of the network adapter for ESX networks.

ip_address.description: IP address for the NIC. Includes both Acropolis assigned IP address as well as learned IP address from thirdparty networks.

mac_address.description: The MAC address of the NIC
mac_address.notes: The MAC address of the NIC

network_uuid.description: The network to which the NIC is attached
network_uuid.notes: The network to which the NIC is attached

port_id.description: The port id for ESX networks.

request_ip.description:
If request_ip is true
If 'requestedIpAddress' is set then request that IP from the network. If it's a managed network then request a dynamic IP from the network. Otherwise don't request an IP. If requestIp is false, then don't request an IP at all, regardless of whether or not the 'requestedIpAddress' is set and whether or the network is managed or not.

assignable.description: Whether the GPU can be assigned to a Virtual Machine.
assignable.notes: Whether the GPU can be assigned to a Virtual Machine.

device_id.description: Device ID of the GPU resource.
device_id.notes: Device ID of the GPU resource.

device_name.description: Vendor device name of the GPU resource.
device_name.notes: Vendor device name of the GPU resource.

fraction.description: Fraction of the physical GPU. Only applicable for a vGPU instance.
fraction.notes: Fraction of the physical GPU. Only applicable for a vGPU instance.

gpu_mode.description: Current mode of the physical GPU. Not valid on vGPU resources.
gpu_mode.notes: Current mode of the physical GPU.

in_use.description: Whether the GPU resource is in use or not.
in_use.notes: Whether the GPU resource is in use or not.

licenses.description: List of license types associated with this GPU.

num_virtual_display_heads.description: Number of supported virtual display heads.
num_virtual_display_heads.notes: Number of supported virtual display heads.

numa_node.description: The NUMA node where the GPU belongs to.
numa_node.notes: The NUMA node where the GPU belongs to.

sbdf.description: Unique device information for the GPU resource.
sbdf.notes: Unique device information for the GPU resource.

vm_uuids.description: List of UUIDs of the Virtual Machines where the GPU resource is assigned.
vm_uuids.notes: List of UUIDs of the Virtual Machines where the GPU resource is assigned.

index.description: The serial port index. Generally limited to the range [0..3], corresponding to COM1 through COM4.

type.description:
The backing type for this serial port.
Possible values- null(The serial device is present, but has no backing), server(The serial device is accessible via a websocket.)
type.notes: The backing type for this serial port.

allow_live_migrate.description: Indicates whether the Virtual Machine can be live migrated or not.
allow_live_migrate.notes: Indicates whether the Virtual Machine can be live migrated or not.

boot.description: Boot configuration for the Virtual Machine. Any updates to the boot configuration will be applied during the next Virtual Machine power cycle but not reset.
boot.notes: Boot configuration for the Virtual Machine.

cbr_not_capable_reason.description: If set to a non-empty string, this VM should be considered incompatible with DR workflows. Applicable only for AHV VMs. In the future, it will be removed in favor of using tags for identifying service VMs.

gpus_assigned.description: Indicates whether the requested GPUs have been assigned to the Virtual Machine or not.
gpus_assigned.notes: Indicates whether the requested GPUs have been assigned to the Virtual Machine or not.

guest_os.description: Guest OS for VMWare. Applicable only for ESX Vms.

ha_priority.description: Priority for restarting in case of HA event.
ha_priority.notes: Priority for restarting in case of HA event. Negative value indicates do not restart.

host_uuid.description: A version 4 UUID identifying the host on which the Virtual Machine is currently running. If Virtual Machine is powered off, then this field is empty.
host_uuid.notes: A version 4 UUID identifying the host on which the Virtual Machine is currently running

memory_mb.description: RAM in megabytes assigned to the Virtual Machine.
memory_mb.notes: RAM in megabytes assigned to the Virtual Machine.

memory_reservation_mb.description: RAM, in megabytes reserved for the Virtual Machine.
memory_reservation_mb.notes: RAM, in megabytes reserved for the Virtual Machine.

name.description: The Virtual Machine human readable name.
name.notes: The Virtual Machine human readable name.

num_cores_per_vcpu.description: Number of cores assigned to each VCPUs.
num_cores_per_vcpu.notes: Number of cores assigned to each VCPUs.

num_vcpus.description: Number of VCPUs assigned to the Virtual Machine.
num_vcpus.notes: Number of VCPUs assigned to the Virtual Machine.

power_state.description: Current power state of the Virtual Machine.
power_state.notes: Current power state of the Virtual Machine.

storage_container_uuid.description: Storage container on which the VM configuration files should be created. Required for ESX, Hyper-V. Not applicable for other hypervisors.
storage_container_uuid.notes: Storage container on which the VM configuration files should be created.

timezone.description: The timezone for the VM's hardware clock. Any updates to the timezone will be applied during the next VM power cycle (but not reset). The default is UTC.
timezone.notes: The timezone for the VM's hardware clock.

tools_installer_mounted.description: The VM's current tools installer mount status.
tools_installer_mounted.notes: The VM's current tools installer mount status.

tools_running_status.description: The VM's current tools installer running status.
tools_running_status.notes: The VM's current tools installer running status.

vcpu_reservation_hz.description: CPU, in Hertz reserved for the Virtual Machine.
vcpu_reservation_hz.notes: CPU, in Hertz reserved for the Virtual Machine.

vm_customization_config.description: Vm customization configuration. At boot time, this config will be replayed by VM customization tool(cloudinit/sysprep) installed in the VM to bring VM to the state defined by this config.

vm_disk_info.description: List of information of disks for a Virtual Machine.
vm_disk_info.notes: List of information of disks for a Virtual Mschine.

vm_features.description: List of features to be enabled for the Virtual Machine.
vm_features.notes: List of features to be enabled for the Virtual Machine.

vm_gpus.description: List of GPUs requested for the Virtual Machine. If "gpus_assigned" is True, then this field represents the assigned physical GPUs.
vm_gpus.notes: List of GPUs requested for the Virtual Machine.

vm_logical_timestamp.description: Logical timestamp specified for consistency. This can be obtained from the Virtual Machine object.

vm_nics.description: List of nics to be added to the Virtual Machine.
vm_nics.notes: List of nics to be added to the Virtual Machine.

flash_mode_enabled.description: Whether the flash mode is enabled for this disk or not.
flash_mode_enabled.notes: Whether the flash mode is enabled for this disk or not.

is_cdrom.description: Whether this is a CD-ROM drive.
is_cdrom.notes: Whether this is a CD-ROM drive.

is_empty.description: Whether the drive is empty. This field only applies to CD-ROM drives.
is_empty.notes: Whether the drive is empty. This field only applies to CD-ROM drives.

is_scsi_passthrough.description: Whether this SCSI disk is attached in passthrough mode to pass all SCSI commands directly to Stargate via iSCSI.
is_scsi_passthrough.notes: Whether this SCSI disk is attached in passthrough mode to pass all SCSI commands directly to Stargate via iSCSI.

is_thin_provisioned.description: Whether the disk is thin provisioned. Note: This field applies to only ESX managed VMs.
is_thin_provisioned.notes: Whether the disk is thin provisioned.

shared.description: Whether disk is shared with others VMs or not.
shared.notes: Whether disk is shared with others VMs or not.

size.description: The size of the disk in bytes
size.notes: The size of the disk in bytes

source_disk_address.description: The address of the source disk.
source_disk_address.notes: The address of the source disk.

storage_container_uuid.description: The container in which the backing vmdisk is provisioned. This field is unset when the drive is empty.
storage_container_uuid.notes: The container in which the backing vmdisk is provisioned. This field is unset when the drive is empty.
